active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the trade-offs of strictly adhering to the Minimal Dependency Principle in a fast-paced agile development environment. When might more dependencies be acceptable (e.g., for rapid prototyping), and what mitigations (e.g., SCA tools, SBOMs) can be applied? Use real-world examples like Log4j or SolarWinds to argue for or against 'zero dependencies is always best.'
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in the Minimal Dependency Principle (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Software Development Security > Secure Coding Guidelines and Standards > 013_Third-Party Component and Dependency Security > Third-Party Library Security > Minimal Dependency Principle). Voter consensus: 100% approval on pedagogy, completeness, etc. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards (Anki-compatible, spaced repetition optimized) covering all Bloom's levels and scaffolding layers. Use the exact schema: Front: [Question or MCQ] Back: Answer: [Correct answer] Explanation: [Detailed, with objective tie-in, example, standard] Bloom's Level: [level] Scaffolding Layer: [1-4] Active Learning Link: [Discussion/Peer teaching/Problem-solving] References: [Hierarchy/sources] Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [paste full list] - Active Learning: [discussion_prompt, peer_teaching_activity, problem_solving_exercise] - Scaffolding: [layer1_foundation, layer2_components, layer3_implementation, layer4_integration] - Research: Definitions (attack surface, blast radius), NIST SSDF, OWASP, Sonatype stats (80% vulns from deps), examples (Log4j, SolarWinds). - Schema rules: Mix types (defs, cloze, MCQs, scenarios); distractors plausible per protocol. Ensure university pedagogy: Active recall, misconceptions addressed, progressive difficulty. Output ONLY as numbered list of flashcards in schema format.
